metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8771 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
This issue was addressed with improved iframe sandbox enforcement. Thisissue is fixed in Safari 13.0.1, iOS 13. Maliciously crafted web contentmay violate iframe sandboxing policy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.26.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
